article.headline: Samford 50, Evansville 49
article.story: EVANSVILLE, Ind. (AP) -- Joe Ross Merritt scored 18 points, including a game-winning layup with one second left, to lead Samford to a 50-49 win over Evansville on Sunday. Travis Peterson scored 14 points and Trey Montgomery added 10 for Samford. Jason Holsinger led all scorers with 19 points for Evansville (0-1). Nate Garner added 10 points and 10 rebounds in Marty Simmons' debut as Evansville's coach. Samford (1-0) led 30-19 at halftime and led by 13 points early in the second half. Evansville took a 47-46 lead on a free throw by Pieter van Tongeren with 3:29 to play, its first lead since the opening minutes. The Purple Aces led 49-46 before Peterson made two free throws for Samford with 53 seconds left to set up Merritt's game winner. Samford shot 50 percent from the field to overcome Evansville's 29-18 rebounding advantage.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
